intro: Acosta balcanica, commonly known as the Balkan acosta, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats, thriving in temperate climates. It is known for its aromatic properties and has been traditionally used in herbal remedies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in its native range.
